news.summary: An analyst's recommendation upgrade put some lively zip in Broadcom's (NASDAQ: AVGO) stock price on Wednesday.  Well before market open on Hump Day, Daiwa Securities' Louis Miscioscia moved Broadcom up one notch, from outperform to buy.  According to reports, the analyst believes Broadcom is standing in front of no less than four elements that could drive its business higher: its custom artificial intelligence (AI) chips, networking, VMWare (an acquisition that closed in late 2023), and its foundational semiconductor products.
